title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 1 September 2017 - BBC News
summary: man jailed for at least 20 years for teen 's murder .
woman jailed for stalking and impersonating police officer .
shrewsbury residents question school places after latest planning decisions .
free nursery places among worst funded in england .

documents.title: fa cup : telford start fa cup at home to barwell
text: afc telford united 's fa cup campaign will start with a home game .
in the draw for the second qualifying round , they 've been paired with barwell , a leicestershire-based side who play a division below the bucks in the northern premier league .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: fa cup : haughmond drawn away to boston united
text: haughmond fc have been rewarded with an away tie against boston united after reaching the second qualifying round of the fa cup for the first time in their history .
their opponents are a former football league side who play in the same division as telford and they get crowds of around 1,000 , so the shropshire side will hope for a healthy amount of gate money .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: charity raises £ 10,000 at v festival
text: the charity village water says says it raised more than £ 10,000 at the v festival last month .
the shrewsbury-based organisation provides safe water and sanitation for communities in rural africa .
village water had more than 100 volunteers at the event , helping campers by renting trolleys and offering a plastic bottle exchange , as glass bottles were n't allowed on the festival site .

documents.title: more roadworks on bridgnorth bypass
text: a new phase of the ongoing roadworks on the bridgnorth bypass starts tonight .
it will involve resurfacing the ludlow road and kidderminster road roundabouts .
the a458 itself is then being resurfaced from wednesday evening , when night-time closures also come into effect .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: jail adds more than 5,000 days to prisoners ' sentences
text: around 5,000 days were added to the sentences of inmates at stoke heath prison last year , because of their bad behaviour .
the figures come from the howard league prison reform charity , which says the practice of adding to sentences needs to stop , because it is adding extra pressure to the system .
stoke heath contains around 750 inmates and handed out more days for bad behaviour than hmp birmingham , which houses roughly twice that number .
it is feeding the problem of an over-crowded , over-stretched prison system . ''

documents.title: football : haughmond manager wants salford cup tie
text: the manager of haughmond fc , matt burton , says he wants to draw salford city in the second qualifying round of the fa cup .
he is a manchester united fan and would love the chance to go up against the team funded and run by ex-united stars like gary neville and paul scholes .
this is the furthest haughmond have ever come in the competition and they got there with a shock 3-2 win over matlock from the northern premier league .
and burton said that at this stage of the competition he will be happy whoever he gets .
i would love salford city away , or telford - anyone really . ''

documents.title: new college principal looks for alternative partnerships
text: the new principal of north shropshire college says it 's no bad thing that a merger with reese heath college in cheshire fell through .
the two colleges accepted the merger was n't going to happen after failing to win financial support from the government .
ian clinton , who officially takes up his post today , says he 'll be looking for a variety of alternative partnerships instead .
author: James Bond
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury manager frustrated by rodman
text: alex rodman was on the score sheet again at the weekend , as shrewsbury town beat gillingham 2-1 away from home , but manager paul hurst says the winger can be frustrating on occasions .
he said the player was `` in his own little world '' at times , but said that 's something he has to live with when he puts rodman on the pitch , knowing he can pop up with important goals .
hurst added that rodman had `` promised me goals '' and that , so far , he has lived up to that promise .
i put him out there , i 've got to live with it , but i may be looking for some of my other players to lead and get hold of him and make sure he 's in the right position . ''

documents.title: future of telford food festival undecided
text: around 6,000 people visited the telfood feastival event in telford town park over the weekend .
the food festival is organised by the same company which puts on the shrewsbury food festival and the shropshire kids festival , shropshire festivals .
it is the second year the event has been held and numbers were slightly down on last year , after bad weather on sunday .
shropshire festivals have n't decided if the festival will return next year .

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers begin life in new league with wins
text: telford tigers had a thrilling opening-night victory over sheffield steeldogs on saturday , eventually winning the game on penalties after the two sides finished level at 3-3 .
and they followed that up with a more comfortable 5-2 win away to the nottingham lions .
it was a mixed weekend for the division two side though - they lost their opening match 8-1 away to altrincham aces , but bounced back with a 16-1 win at home to the deeside dragons second team .

documents.title: football : haughmond seek 'big name ' after fa cup shock win
text: shropshire side haughmond are hoping for a big name in the fa cup draw this lunchtime after their win in the first qualifying round .
the amateurs pulled off a shock on saturday as the midland football league side beat matlock from the northern premier league 3-2 at the shrewsbury sports village .
the next stage of the draw sees the national north teams come in .
author: BBC Shropshire

documents.title: horse trapped in cattle grid cut free
text: firefighters had to free a horse after it got trapped in a cattle grid near ellesmere .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: huge £ 1.2m conservation project starting on ironbridge
text: work to surround the ironbridge in shropshire in scaffolding starts today .
it 's all part of a £ 1.2m restoration project by english heritage , which the charity describes as its `` single largest conservation project to date '' .
the work is needed because , they say , some of the ironwork is showing signs of cracking due to factors including a 19th century earthquake .
scaffolding is needed before conservation work can start later this autumn .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a cloudy start with some bursts of rain and drizzle it should be a largely dry day with some bright spells this afternoon and highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: gillingham 1-2 shrewsbury town
text: gillingham 1-2 shrewsbury town

documents.title: 'catfish ' stalker impersonated police
text: 'catfish ' stalker impersonated police

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for herefordshire and worcestershire have finished for the day but we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday with more live news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: hare coursing appeal after sightings
text: police are asking people to report incidents of hare coursing in shropshire after men have been seen trespassing on private land in hotspot areas , police say .
hare coursing - where dogs are used to chase , catch and kill hares - is illegal in the uk and a conviction can lead to a fine of up to £ 5,000 .
hoptspots include parts of bishop 's castle , totterton and plowden police say .
the individuals have been known to be part of the criminal fraternity , possibly with links to organised crime , a force spokesperson said .
people are asked to try to note down the coursers ' vehicle registration when they report it to the force .
`` coursers know they are breaking the law and may take drastic actions not to get caught , please do not approach them , '' they added .

documents.title: football : a look ahead to afc telford 's match against blyth spartans
text: the bucks go in search of their first home points of the season .
preview : the bucks prepare to do battle with spartans tomorrow at the new bucks head @ twitterid

documents.title: shrewsbury to make late decision on back-up keeper
text: paul hurst will make a late decision on who 'll be shrewsbury town 's substitute goalkeeper at gillingham tomorrow .
first-choice dean henderson 's away on england under-21 duty , so number-two craig mcgillivray takes his place .
in reserve will be either teenager cameron gregory , who was on the bench for town 's checkatrade trophy tie in midweek , or the club 's 44-year-old goalkeeping coach , danny coyne .
town 's assistant manager chris doig says both will travel to gillingham .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: the west midlands will have a completely dry and rather chilly night with long clear spells .
some mist patches may develop , especially in rural parts of shropshire and staffordshire - lows of 10c ( 50f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: barracks homes plan prompts questions over school places
text: councillors have approved a proposal to turn the copthorne barracks site into 240 homes , despite hearing concerns about a lack of school places .
plans to build 120 homes on the nearby radbrook college site and 109 student rooms at the dana prison were also approved yesterday .
here 's what people on bbc radio shropshire 's facebook page think of the barracks plans .

sally nicholson wrote : `` do we really need more houses being built in shrewsbury - how are the schools and doctors in the area going to cope - it is already extremely difficult to get an appointment with a doctor as it is ! ''
steve davo davies said : `` surely they could convert some of the premises into a primary school/nursery and little shop .
with those big gates it could be a lovely little community but undoubtedly it will be snapped up by a greedy developer in town charging over the top for scrawny little apartments . ''
and steve summer wrote : `` there are no extra school places or doctors or hospitals for the otley road and mousecroft lane developments - so what makes anyone think this is a clever idea ? ''
let us know what you think here .

documents.title: football : brazil are in town
text: are you going to watch england u18s take on brazil at shrewsbury 's home ground tonight ?
it 's a warm-up match for england 's under-18s , ahead of their world cup campaign next month .
england : do n't forget that england under-18s take on brazil at the mwm tonight - tickets on sale # salop >

documents.title: woman jailed for stalking and impersonating police
text: a woman 's been jailed for stalking and impersonating a police officer after `` controlling and manipulating '' her former partner for more than two years .
lauren adderly , from sundorne crescent in shrewsbury , set up fake emails from police officers in order to control the man 's behaviour , the crown prosecution service ( cps ) said .
her campaign started after he encouraged her to go to police to report a sexual offence she said she was the victim of earlier on in her life , the cps said .
she agreed , providing he would act as a witness and give a supporting statement .
the 21-year-old then created numerous fictional characters online , including senior police officers , the senior lawyer apparently dealing with the case and other supposed witnesses , the cps said .

jason corden-bowen , district crown prosecutor and domestic abuse lead with west midlands cps said : `` she used this sophisticated catfish style behaviour to completely manipulate the victim 's life , dictating when he could go out , where he could go and controlled his social interaction with other people for over two years . ''
adderly was jailed for nine months at shrewsbury crown court after previously admitting the two charges .

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers return to league action
text: telford tigers return to the ice tomorrow , to play a home match against the sheffield steeldogs .

both sides dropped down to the national ice hockey league after the collapse of the english premier league and have retained a number of last season 's players , so they will be among the stronger sides in division one north .
on sunday , they will travel to the national ice centre to play the nottingham lions .
the tigers are also fielding a side in division two this season and they will open their league campaign on the road to altrincham aces , before welcoming deeside 2 to the telford ice rink .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: telford mp lucy allan demands better rail service for borough
text: telford mp lucy allan has demanded better rail services for the borough .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: phone parking system extended
text: shropshire council 's extending its pay-by-phone system to all of the car parks it owns from today .
it means you can pay for parking via phone , text or a smartphone app .
this had already been the case at three car parks in shrewsbury .
shaun sutton , who manages the parking enforcement team , said it saves drivers a lot time .
i imagine it probably takes five minutes or so on the first occasion to get your details and your vehicle in but from then on it 's really straightforward . ''

documents.title: man stabbed boy , 16 , through the heart
text: man stabbed boy , 16 , through the heart

documents.title: police baffled why teen was killed
text: police said it was unclear why michael warham had travelled to shrewsbury on the day he was killed .
they added he was visiting the town with his girlfriend but the investigating team could n't establish why he was killed .

documents.title: breakingman jailed for life for stabbing teenager in his heart
text: a man has been jailed for life for the murder of a teenage boy who was found lying on a road after trouble erupted between two groups of males .
michael warham , 16 , from liverpool , was found by a member of the public with multiple injuries in wayford close in meole brace on 1 august last year .
he was taken to hospital for emergency surgery but died three days later , west mercia police said .
declan graves , 20 , from speke in liverpool , will serve a minimum of 20 years after being found guilty of his murder at stafford crown court .

this has been a challenging investigation and i sincerely hope that today 's conviction is of some comfort to michael 's family who have been left to face the full repercussions of grave 's actions in the most painful way . ''

documents.title: council marks merchant navy day
text: flying the flag at shirehall .
raising the # redensign to mark # merchantnavyday 2017 on sunday .
the flag will fly outside shirehall until monday .

documents.title: your hazy ludlow
text: here 's a photo of a rather hazy ludlow this morning taken by bbc weather watcher foggy .
if you would like to send in photos of your area , visit the website .

documents.title: football : look ahead to shrewsbury 's clash with gillingham
text: goalkeeper macgillivray says you have to be `` ready for anything '' .
interview | craig macgillivray pre gillingham : via @ twitterid

documents.title: prison to become student accommodation
text: plans to redevelop the former jail in shrewsbury have been backed by councillors .
the scheme will see the grade ii listed dana 's main prison block , which closed in 2013 , turned into student accommodation with up to 109 rooms .
there 'll also be flats , shops , cafe and extra car parking spaces .
councillors said they felt earlier concerns had been addressed .
conservative councillor dean carroll said the plans will preserve the historic fabric of the building but modify it in such a way that it integrates with the local community .
it 's an extremely sensitive site and we have to be very careful of the proposals for it to make sure they are right for the site and in keeping with the surrounding area and the town . ''

documents.title: victim speaks out over her ordeal at hands of oswestry truck driver
text: a woman has revealed the horrifying sexual abuse she suffered as a 13-year-old girl in shropshire at the hands of her mother 's boyfriend .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: nursery closure warning over free childcare change
text: there are warnings that nurseries in shropshire could close because the government is n't paying them enough for an increase in free childcare .
from today , all three and four-year-olds are eligible for 30 hours ' free childcare a week , rather than 15 , as long as both parents are working a minimum number of hours .
but the national day nurseries association says the government is only giving the county 's nurseries £ 4.01 per child per hour , among the lowest in the country .
in telford , the government provides £ 4.32 an hour per child .
the government says it 's raising the hourly rate it pays to councils to a level far higher than the average cost of providing childcare .

documents.title: football : the new saints prepare for scottish opposition
text: the new saints will be at home to livingston from the scottish championship this weekend .
they 're playing in the scottish league cup , which started including the top teams from wales and northern ireland last season .
after reaching the semi-finals last year , manager scott ruscoe is hopeful of another strong run in the competition .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: affordable homes plan for barracks
text: more than 200 homes are expected to be built on the site of the copthorne barracks in shrewsbury , after planning permission was granted yesterday afternoon .
they will be a mixture of apartments , houses and retirement homes , alongside 45 affordable homes .
the barracks was one almost of 100 sites put up for sale by the ministry of defence last year as part of a major restructuring .
veterans want reassurance that 15 of these properties will be earmarked for them and the detail will be worked on before going back to shropshire council for final approval .
norman mcguigan , from shrewsbury veteran association , said he would like to see the keep , armoury and one or two out-buildings retained for veterans .

we would like a percentage of homes obviously for our veterans because we 're seeing an increasing number of homeless veterans right across the uk and we do know there are some veterans in shropshire that need affordable homes . ''

documents.title: motorist guilty of dangerous driving after motorcyclist lost leg in a49 crash
text: a wem man has been found guilty of dangerous driving following an accident in which a motorcyclist lost part of his leg .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: leitch-smith joins dundee on loan
text: leitch-smith joins dundee on loan

documents.title: out-of-date passport 'missed three times '
text: a woman 's described her distress after her daughter was sent home from france because her passport was out of date .
janet kimmings , from shrewsbury , says her daughter jackie had her passport checked at birmingham airport on three occasions before being allowed to board .
it was only when she arrived in france the problem was discovered .
how did we have our passport checked three times in birmingham by three different people at three different stages and they missed it three times .
she was sent home and i was left behind the barrier .
it was horrible . ''
birmingham airport and flybe say they 're in the process of investigating .

documents.title: football : haughmond fc hope to continue fa cup run
text: haughmond fc play matlock in the fa cup first qualifying round tomorrow .
the club has come through two extra qualifying rounds to reach this stage and it 's the furthest they have ever been in the tournament .
manager matt burton is hoping that with shrewsbury town away from home this weekend , a few of their fans might turn up to boost the crowd numbers .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : today 's weather in 50-seconds
text: it 's been a sunny start to the day and here 's how the rest of friday is looking across the west midlands .
you can also keep up-to-date on the latest forecasts at any other time by heading to the bbc weather website .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on friday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: oswestry bus depot land up for sale
text: the land occupied by oswestry bus depot has gone on the market for £ 600,000 .

arriva , which operates the depot , said its lease expires in september 2018 and it was `` proactively discussing several different options '' for the future , `` all of which are based in oswestry '' .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: farmer reveals naked ambitions
text: a north shropshire farmer is hoping a prehistoric crop could make its way into cereal and salad bowls .
stephen jones , who farms at hordley , near ellesmere , is hoping to reintroduce naked barley , a crop that died out in britain during the iron age .
it was replaced about 3,000 years ago by wheat , which we 've been eating ever since .
mr jones reckons naked barley is worth another look .

the market for this is going to be in things like flaking , so putting it into breakfast cereals , malting it as well , but i think also we can open up new markets by continuing to improve the breeding process .
i think for me , one of the main things i 'm looking at is putting it into salads . ''

documents.title: vehicle seized in crackdown on rogue scrap metal dealers
text: a vehicle has been seized during an operation to target rogue scrap metal dealers , telford and wrekin council said .
the authority carried out two early morning exercises in newport and the surrounding areas of telford following reports that unlicensed scrap metal dealers were operating in the borough .
council licensing officers and west mercia police patrolled a number of areas on 22 and 30 august .
the council said an unlicensed vehicle was seized and impounded for being driven without insurance and its driver is due to be interviewed by the authority .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: any remaining daytime showers will fade away during this evening , leaving a dry night with clear spells for all .
under the clear skies it will be another chilly night , with a few mist or fog patches possibly forming - lows of 10c ( 50f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: spireites sign shrewsbury defender jules
text: spireites sign shrewsbury defender jules

documents.title: breakingbarracks homes bid approved by planners
text: plans to build 230 homes on the copthorne barracks site in shrewsbury have been approved .
the development will include a mixture of apartments , houses and retirement homes .
there was concern over the number of affordable homes in the plans , the number of homes for veterans and the loss of a well-used playing field on the site .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: transfer deadline day : dan james returns to swansea after shrewsbury town loan
text: dan james has returned to swansea from his loan with shrewsbury town , the club has confirmed .
the welsh under-21 winger has n't played for the first team since joining in the summer .
done deal : dan james will return to @ twitterid after his loan was mutually ended # salop # deadlineday >
please do n't tell me this is what you teased us for
@ twitterid
what went wrong ?
well there 's long n short loans but that was a flash in the pan loan lol
the shortest season long loan in history ?
aww what a shame
such a talent

documents.title: dana prison set to be turned into student flats
text: shrewsbury 's old jail is expected to be turned into student accommodation , after councillors gave the green light to developers this afternoon .
the scheme would see 109 rooms created from the main prison block at the dana .
there 'd also be flats , shops , cafe and extra car parking spaces .
the proposal was backed unanimously by councillors who felt earlier concerns had been addressed .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: breakingplans to redevelop former dana prison passed
text: plans to redevelop the former dana prison in shrewsbury have been unanimously backed by shropshire council planners .
this is outline planning permission and further work is expected to be carried out .
author: Joanne Gallacher
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford rail concerns discussed
text: extra trains and carriages are desperately needed on trains between birmingham new street and telford , the town 's mp says .
the franchise for the wales and the borders route , currently operated by arriva trains wales , is due for renewal next year and train operators are working on their bids to run the service .
conservative mp lucy allan said the tendering process was a `` real opportunity for us to ensure telford gets the services it needs '' and to make sure the town was n't `` forgotten '' .
earlier this month london midland lost the contract to run the west midlands rail franchise , which includes the line between shrewsbury and wolverhampton .
getting telford better connected is essential for telford 's future success - business jobs and growth depend upon it . ''

documents.title: radbrook college homes bid passed by planners
text: plans to redevelop the former radbrook college in shrewsbury have been passed .
the college had been used by shrewsbury college of arts and technology until 2014 .
floreat homes will build 120 homes on the grounds of the 14-acre site .
local residents complained they 'd lose their playing field if the scheme went ahead .
planners backed the scheme after hearing developers would hand over £ 60,000 to be spent on existing parks within the area .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: body-worn camera rollout nears completion
text: the rollout of body-worn video to west mercia police 's front-line officers and staff is nearing completion , the region 's police and crime commissioner has said .
those in worcestershire , shropshire and telford are already using the technology , with herefordshire to follow in the coming weeks .
john campion said the technology was giving people `` greater confidence '' in the police .
part of a £ 1m investment in new technology , he said it was also delivering on a pledge `` to deliver the modern , forward thinking police force '' that local communities `` deserve '' .
the higher quality of evidence this delivers , provides a higher quality of service for victims and increases the chance of justice being served .

documents.title: storm of protest at refusal of ludlow hospital donation
text: pressure is mounting on health chiefs to think again about a decision to refuse a charitable donation of £ 2,500 for equipment at ludlow hospital .
author: Ludlow & Tenbury Wells Advertiser

documents.title: 'toxic ' diet pills for sale on website
text: 'toxic ' diet pills for sale on website

documents.title: motorists encouraged to be 'more mindful ' of motorcyclists
text: car drivers are being urged to be more aware of motorcyclists as part of a police campaign .
warwickshire police and west mercia police have teamed up with the safer roads partnership as part of a national scheme to reduce motorcycle-related collisions and casualties .
figures reveal 535 people were either killed or seriously injured in the warwickshire and west mercia policing areas by collisions involving motorcycles in the three years to 2016 .

documents.title: 'money over morals ' in diet pills sales
text: the mother of a shrewsbury girl who died from a diet pill overdose said some people selling them were `` putting money over morals '' .
two years ago , bbc inside out and the mother of eloise parry , who died from a diet pill overdose , confronted the man who ran the site from turkey .
while it is not thought orhan topcuer supplied miss parry , he agreed to stop selling the product on his site .
a web page with an identical domain name appears to be selling them again .
there 's just a very , very small number of registrars who will allow websites like these to continue to operate .
the vast majority are highly responsible and take them down as soon as they are aware of them .
but a small , small number put money over morals and allow them to set back up again . ''

documents.title: your bbc weather watchers
text: our bbc weather watchers have been busy taking these stunning snaps from across the county .
ray took this image of a cat watching the sun go up in oakengates .
meanwhile , this striking image in ellesmere was taken by rick and meg 10000 steps .
sign up to bbc weather watchers and you could see your here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: radbrook college redevelopment plans due to be discussed by planners
text: the latest stage in the plans to redevelop the former radbrook college site in shrewsbury go before shropshire council this afternoon .
floreat homes want to develop the grounds of the 14-acre site that could see as many as 120 houses and apartments .

david kilby , from the shropshire playing fields association , has said the developers want to give shrewsbury town council £ 60,00 to build play and recreation facilities off sight - which means families would have to walk along a dangerous road .
the meeting takes place at 14:00 .

documents.title: police investigate vehicle thefts in and around oswestry
text: police are investigating following a series of thefts from vehicles in and around oswestry .
author: Oswestry & Border Counties Advertizer

documents.title: farmer hopes to reintroduce iron age crop
text: a farmer from hordley , near ellesmere , is attempting to re-introduce a crop which died out in britain during the iron age .
stephen jones is growing naked barley , which he says is easier to thresh than conventional barley .
the strain was popular for bread-making 3,000 years ago but was replaced by wheat flour .
mr jones says it only uses half the water needed to grow wheat , which could offer farmers a big advantage .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: cricket : monty panesar in oswestry for lashings xi
text: oswestry cricket club is hosting one of its biggest ever games today - against a touring team of ex-internationals .
the former england spinner monty panesar is the star for the lashings xi - who play around the country to promote the game .
panesar took 167 wickets for england in a 50-test career .
the t20 game starts at around half-past three - and bbc test match special commentator henry blofeld is a special guest .
author: Nigel Dolman
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : flowers for diana , 20 years ago
text: deborah judson from shrewsbury has shared this photo of the flowers laid at the top of pride hill after the death of princess diana .
diana died exactly 20 years ago after a car crash in paris on 31 august 1997 aged 36 .
in the immediate aftermath , a sea of flowers was laid outside her home at kensington palace .
the act was mirrored in towns across the country and even further afield .
ms judson said she remembered flowers being left both on pride hill and the quarry as a tribute .

documents.title: barracks plans to be considered
text: revised plans to build 230 homes on the copthorne barracks site in shrewsbury will be going before shropshire councillors today .
the development would include a mixture of apartments , houses and retirement homes .
the report going before the authority 's planning committee recommends the application is approved .
there 's been concern over the number of affordable homes in the plans , the number of homes for veterans and the loss of a well-used playing field on the site .

documents.title: naturists object to 450-homes plan in telford
text: naturists have objected to a scheme to build 450 houses in telford - because they fear they will be overlooked by home-owner .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: new principal takes over north shropshire college
text: north shropshire college has welcomed a new principal and chief executive .
ian clinton takes over from the interim head peter mccann .
earlier this month , plans to merge the college with reesheath college in nantwich were shelved after failing to attract government funding .
north shropshire college has been struggling with its finances and with critical inspection reports .
the two institutions have been working together for over a year , to turn things around .
the two colleges said they would now look for an alternative way forward , rather than a formal merger .

documents.title: ambulance patient reports rape by staff member
text: a patient has made a report of rape against a member of west midlands ambulance service .
it is among the `` serious incidents '' involving ambulances that have risen by 16 % in five years .
the number of such events rose in seven of england 's 10 ambulance areas .
the union unison said the rise reflected `` intolerable pressures '' facing ambulance workers .
the association of ambulance chief executives said the incidents amounted to a `` tiny '' number of patient journeys .
reported cases include a patient conveyed by west midlands ambulance service who ended up needing a leg amputation in 2014 after falling in an ambulance .
police have so far not brought any charges in connection with the rape report , made in january .

documents.title: football : world cup winners to play at new bucks head
text: england 's under-20s team will be playing their first game since lifting the world cup tonight - at telford 's new bucks head ground .
they 'll be playing the netherlands - over 1,000 tickets have been sold for the fixture .
england beat venezuela in june to win the under-20s tournament in south korea .
it 's great that the football association have chosen the new bucks head as the venue for this u20s fixture .
we will no doubt put on a great showcase event and look forward to continuing our excellent working relationship with those at the fa . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: dana prison revamp goes before planners
text: a planning application is going before shropshire councillors later today , including proposals to turn the main prison block at shrewsbury 's former jail into a large student accommodation block , containing up to 109 units .
it also suggests turning the gatehouse into three flats and the former prison kitchen into either shops or a restaurant or cafe .
the outline planning application also proposes turning the gymnasium into a fitness centre and creating parking spaces for 91 vehicles .

documents.title: man died in 'lost keys ' ambulance drama
text: man died in 'lost keys ' ambulance drama
author: Laurence Cawley
BBC News

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: a mainly dry , bright and chilly start , but showers across the far west , will become more widespread through the day .
the showers will turn heavy and thundery in places , but in between some pleasant spells of sunshine will develop - highs of 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on thursday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: deadly diet pill on sale again
text: a website is once again listing a dangerous diet pill which had been removed from sale after a shrewsbury girl died from taking it .
eloise parry died in 2015 after taking illegal diet pills called 2,4 dinitrophenol , or dnp , that she 'd bought off the internet .
her mother fiona parry said she is not surprised to see the drug being sold again , because it is a lucrative business , but accused them of putting `` money over morals '' .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : more showers forecast tomorrow
text: autumn appears to have arrived early in the west midlands and there are more showers forecast for tomorrow .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: lorries crash at telford industrial estate
text: two lorries were involved in a crash at a telford industrial estate today .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your photos : bridgnorth from above and cow grazing in south shropshire
text: we 've had a real variety of photos from the bbc weather watchers this afternoon , including this one of bridgnorth taken from high town ( top ) and the photo of a cow ( bottom ) in longnor .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : injury problems clearing up for tns
text: the new saints ' early-season injury problems are clearing up with only steve saunders and chris marriott remaining on the treatment table .
and manager scott ruscoe said ryan brobbel is now pressing for a return to action .
saunders is likely to be out for another five or six weeks with a thigh strain and there is no definite return date for chris marriott after his knee operation .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: railway appeal reaches £ 1.5m mark
text: a share-issue to raise £ 2.5m for the severn valley railway has just reached the £ 1.5m mark , since november , but has just two months to gather the remaining £ 1m .
the money will be spent on the redevelopment of its station in bridgnorth , which is already under way .
the heritage railway is calling the project `` the most ambitious restoration and development in the railway 's 52-year history '' and is still hopeful of hitting its target in time .

documents.title: football : riley not ready for full shrewsbury return yet
text: shrewsbury town 's joe riley has earned praise from his manager after coming off the subs bench to score the winner against coventry last night .
but , paul hurst says fans have to be patient , because he is n't fit enough for a full 90 minutes after returning from a long-term injury ,
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: warning over poisonous blue-green algae
text: dangerous blue-green algae has appeared at a shropshire beauty spot , with people told to stay away from the water .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: flashmob protest plans likely to be dropped
text: it looks like plans for a flashmob protest in support of ludlow fund-raisers will be dropped .

supporters of the men , who dressed as female nurses to raise money for their local hospital , will be meeting tonight to decide how best to proceed , but are backing down on their original plans for a demonstration next month .
the fund-raisers were unhappy when shropshire community health trust rejected the £ 2,500 they collected , saying it was `` insulting '' to the nursing profession .

documents.title: cause of shifnal hole remains unknown
text: a small hole which opened up in the five ways roundabout in shifnal yesterday remains a mystery , with shropshire council saying it 's still not sure what caused it .
its engineers are working with severn trent water to investigate and says the temporary traffic lights there will remain for the time being .
part of haughton lane will also remain closed .

documents.title: british titles for shropshire pair
text: two young bmx riders from telford have up silverware at the british championships in derby .
six-year-old archie smallman ( below , left ) and 16-year-old callum edwards ( below , right ) both came third in their categories to take `` british number three '' titles .
both boys are members of wrekin riders bmx race club in dawley and were representing the midlands region .
a number of their other riders also performed well with martin brown and josh orr both competing in the same class as callum and narrowly missing out on a place in the final .

documents.title: shrewsbury town contributes to safe standing appeal
text: shrewsbury town says it is the mystery donor that has contributed £ 20,000 to an appeal to raise money for a safe standing area in its stadium .
when the supporter 's parliament fans ' group first came up with the idea , the club said it would n't contribute , but chief executive brian caldwell said there had been a rethink
he said he hoped the donation would add momentum to the fundraising which has reached the halfway mark with 13 days to go .
the appeal launched on 1 august and is looking to raise £ 75,000 by 12 september , to pay for around 500 rail seats .

we 're all in this together and it gave an opportunity for the club to put something into it as well and hopefully boost everybody , because it has been so widely supported and hopefully the momentum continues . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: praise for 'fab ' stone-painting 'craze '
text: the shropshire rocks stone-painting phenomenon has been described as a `` fab craze '' by the clerk of shrewsbury town council .

helen ball has raised concerns about the activity , saying the stones could get caught up in mowers , or be used by vandals - but she said her staff would only remove them if they were placed in appropriate places and that she might even have a go at painting some herself .
she said `` a few hundred '' had been found in the town 's quarry park and that most were perfectly fine where they were .
it 's a fab craze and when you look on the facebook page some of the artwork that is on some of these stones is absolutely outstanding . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: driver clocked at 75mph in shropshire village 's 30mph zone
text: a car was clocked travelling at more than 70mph in a shropshire village 's 30mph zone .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: town council unhappy with stone-painting craze
text: the craze in shropshire this summer for decorating small stones in bright colours is causing `` concern '' for shrewsbury town council .

it says it 's noticed `` numerous painted rocks '' placed around the quarry park and the dingle and it 's worried they might get caught up in mowers and perhaps `` cause injuries to people innocently sitting on benches close by '' .
the town council also said its staff had witnessed children throwing the stones at ducks and believes they may have been used to draw on the base of the park 's war memorial .
it says it has instructed its staff to remove the stones if they are a `` danger to other users '' of the park .

whilst we do not wish to be killjoys , we would urge parents to ensure that their children are hiding rocks that do n't become a hazard to other users of the park , the wildlife which inhabits the park and our staff who work there . ''

documents.title: your photos : bright flowers on a dull day in shropshire
text: the skies might be grey , but the photos being shared by the bbc weather watchers today are bright and full of flowers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: flashmob protest planned in support of fund-raisers
text: a flashmob protest is being planned in support of fund-raisers who had their donation to ludlow hospital rejected .
the shropshire community health trust objected because they were dressed as female nurses , saying it was `` insulting to the profession '' .
that decision has been criticised by many , with thousands signing an online petition calling for a rethink .

documents.title: large straw fire near ellesmere
text: firefighters spent more than four hours dealing with a fire involving 82 tonnes of straw near ellesmere yesterday evening .
three engines were called to a property on elson road at 16:23 .

documents.title: twenty one arrests in summer crackdown
text: an anti-drugs operation in shropshire has resulted in 21 arrests and six people charged over the past three months , police say .
on top of that cocaine and cannabis was seized , six vehicles were seized and stolen property was recovered .
the arrests were for drug offences , driving offences and people wanted on recall to prison .
this operation was weeks in the planning and i am very pleased that it has been a success . ''

documents.title: cricket : shropshire 's over-60s through to national final
text: shropshire 's over-60s cricket team is through to the final of the county championship knockout cup after a five-wicket win over oxfordshire .
the match was played at shrewsbury cricket club and the visitors scored 214-7 off their 45 overs .
shropshire reached their target of 215 with three overs to spare , with captain john foster leading the way with 127 not out .

documents.title: crackdown on telford fly-tipping
text: there 's a crackdown today on people who dump household items like mattresses , fridges and washers in the street outside their homes .
telford and wrekin council , shropshire fire rescue , the police and a housing firm have been meeting on woodside this morning as part of a pride in our community campaign .
paul fenn , an enforcement officer for the council says there are a number of ways of tracking down culprits , including cctv and covert filming .

documents.title: car fans treated to display by telford university students
text: talented university students from telford showed off their racing cars as thousands turned out for morgan motor company 's annual car show .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: appeal planned against chicken farm
text: some residents in bridgnorth say they 'll appeal against plans for a chicken farm that 's set to house 210,000 birds .
shropshire councillors have given a tasley farmer the green light to put up four buildings .
several residents say the dust will leave them with health problems like asthma , but the majority of councillors on a panel disagreed .

documents.title: coventry city 2-3 shrewsbury town
text: shrewsbury town 's joe riley celebrated a fairytale return from long-term injury last night by powering home a last-minute winner in town 's 3-2 checkatrade trophy success at coventry .
shrewsbury were in control at half-time - two up via goals from stefan payne and arthur gnahoua .
but they let it slip to 2-2 before riley grabbed the headlines .

documents.title: watch : today 's weather for the west midlands
text: a wet start for some of us - here 's how the rest of wednesday is looking .
you can also find updated weather forecasts at any other time via the bbc weather website .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to live updates from bbc shropshire on wednesday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday , but keep an eye out here for more updates before then .

documents.title: in oswestry balloon festival
text: we had perfect weather for the first oswestry balloon festival over the bank holiday weekend .
they launched from the british ironworks centre , with around 40 balloons taking part .

documents.title: cricket : shropshire start semi-final run chase
text: shropshire are off to a good start in their semi-final run chase against oxfordshire .
they 've been set 215 to win their county cricket championship over-60s game at shrewsbury and are currently 83-1 in the 17th over .
the captain , john foster , is leading the way with 48 not out .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: emergency repairs after pot hole opens up in shifnal
text: there could be some congestion getting in and out of shifnal this evening , because a hole has opened up in the five ways traffic island .
shropshire council says part of haughton lane has been closed and temporary traffic lights have been set up to allow emergency repairs to be carried out .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: cloud will thicken overnight with outbreaks of rain arriving during the early hours .
this will then become heavier and more widespread towards dawn - lows of 12c ( 54f ) .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: football : hurst says derby games are good for efl trophy
text: shrewsbury town kick off their efl trophy campaign away to coventry city tonight and manager paul hurst says derbies like this might help boost attendances for the competition .
it 's suffered from low crowds and teams putting out reserve players in the past .
this season the tournament has been arranged so that all the group-stage matches are local ones .
tonight 's match will also pit hurst against his former rotherham team-mate mark robins , who manages coventry .
it 'll be good to see mark and i 'm sure it 'll be a tough game to get the group underway . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: 'no guarantee ' on relief road funding
text: there is `` no guarantee '' there will be money available for shrewsbury to have a new relief road , shropshire council has said .

the authority was given nearly £ 1m by the department for transport to draw up an outline business case for the road and says it will have to lobby to get funding if the opportunity arises in the future .
a public consultation on the plans will begin in october , to update surveys last carried out in 2007 .
there are currently no guaranteed national funding opportunities that would see an emergent positive business case leading to an application for future construction costs

documents.title: more shropshire police officers get body-worn cameras
text: body-worn cameras are now being issued to more police officers in shropshire , after a roll-out in telford earlier this year .

the west mercia force is spending £ 1m on the technology and police and crime commissioner john campion ( below ) claimed it should increase transparency and reassure the public justice was being done .
the force was criticised for not having cameras to record police actions , following the death of dalian atkinson last year .
video captures events in a way that can not be represented in written statements .
footage helps to show the real impact a crime can have on victims and helps to ensure total transparency in police actions

documents.title: cricket : shropshire set 215 to win over-60s semi-final
text: shropshire 's over-60s cricketers have been set 215 to win their semi-final match against oxfordshire at shrewsbury .
the visitors were put into bat after losing the toss and scored 214 for 7 off their 45 overs .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shrewsbury relief road plans 'on target '
text: plans for a new relief road around shrewsbury are `` on target '' , shropshire council has said .
it 's preparing an outline business case , which includes a survey of traffic around the town , which it plans to give to the department for transport by 22 december .
the authority was given £ 942,875 by the dft to prepare this report .

documents.title: breakingpoultry shed plans approved amid 'shame on you ' shouts
text: plans to build four poultry units housing 210,000 chickens have been approved by shropshire council .
campaigners shouted `` shame on you '' as the majority of councillors voted in favour of the scheme at tasley , near bridgnorth .
locals complained dust from the birds would affect their health , but their concerns were overridden .
they say they 'll now appeal .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: american football : shropshire to face glasgow in brit bowl
text: shropshire revolution will play glasgow tigers in the first brit bowl final in their 11-year history , after victory over gateshead senators at the weekend .
their opponents came into the game with an impressive 9-1 record , but were shut out by the revolution at oakengates with the game ending 35-0 .

shropshire lost in the brit bowl semi finals in 2010 , 2011 and 2014 and head coach stephen tonks said the win was extra special for the veteran players and coaches still with the team who had tasted defeat in those games .
the final will be played at the john charles stadium in leeds on 10 september .
i really could n't be prouder of this team .
they 've put in so much hard work and effort , to see them reach the final is brilliant
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: baler destroyed in fire near bridgnorth
text: a baler has been completely destroyed in a blaze near bridgnorth .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your photos : grey squirrel on a grey day in shropshire
text: the sunshine we enjoyed over the bank holiday weekend is gone , but that 's not stopping the bbc weather watchers getting out to take photos like this one in oakengates .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: mother wants hereford to follow telford hospital lead
text: a hereford mum whose daughter was still-born says the county needs to follow shropshire and have a dedicated bereavement suite and midwife .
laura culpin , from pontrilas , gave birth to penelope at 31 weeks in a normal delivery ward , despite knowing her baby had already died .
the women and children 's unit , at the princess royal hospital in telford , has a trained bereavement midwife and dedicated room .
mrs culpin wants the same and she 's now helping to fundraise for hereford county hospital to help improve the experience for other families who lose a baby at birth .

documents.title: judo : shropshire 's edwards goes out in first round
text: telford 's kelly edwards ( has been knocked out of the world judo championships in the first round .
she lost to portugal 's joana ramos .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : protesters welcome councillors visiting chicken farm site
text: protesters opposing plans for four large chicken sheds at a farm near bridgnorth have welcomed shropshire councillors visiting the site ahead of a planning meeting later today .
they 're unhappy at the proposals put forward by footbridge farm , at tasley , for units capable of housing 210,000 birds .
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: football : goalkeeping coach , 44 , on the bench tonight
text: shrewsbury town 's 44-year-old goalkeeping coach danny coyne will be on the bench tonight .
the club is without first-choice keeper dean henderson , who is away with the england under-21 squad , while shaun rowley is on loan at tamworth .
craig macgillivray is the only other goalie on shrewsbury 's books and is set to start against coventry .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shrewsbury north west relief road plan getting closer
text: a public consultation will be launched this autumn as the proposed shrewsbury north west relief road moves a step closer .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: safe standing appeal passes halfway mark
text: shrewsbury town 's bid to raise £ 75,000 to create a safe standing area in their stadium has passed the halfway mark .
the club 's supporter 's parliament started an online appeal on 1 august to collect the money needed to rip out the old seats and replace them with rail seating .
it set itself a deadline of 12 september - 14 days away .
so far £ 40,811 has been donated and there have been 599 individual contributions .
the biggest one that has been made public has come from the manchester united supporters trust , which gave more than £ 2,000 .

documents.title: plans for yurts near clun set to get approval
text: plans to put up six yurts in a farmer 's field near clun will go before shropshire councillors today .
the land is in an area of outstanding natural beauty and clun town council and a number of local residents have raised concerns about noise , litter and fires there .
a report drawn up by officers accepts development of the land is a sensitive issue , but suggests the campsite is given planning permission , subject to a number of conditions .

documents.title: efl trophy : coventry city v shrewsbury town
text: shrewsbury town start in the efl trophy away to coventry tonight .
the game at the ricoh arena kicks off at 19:45 .
the final is at wembley but the early games do n't attract much fan-interest .
but shrewsbury boss paul hurst , who won the competition as a player , is right behind it .
i do n't care what people say about it , i want to progress and the end goal is to lift the trophy
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cricket : shropshire over-60s in national semi final
text: shropshire are playing in the semi final of the county cricket championship over-60s cup today .
they beat wales in the quarter-finals to set up today 's match against oxfordshire at shrewsbury cricket club .
the game starts at 13:00 and will be 45 overs per side .
we tend to move a bit more slowly than we used to in years gone by , but we do have a bit of fun and we enjoy playing
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: drivers braced for more roadworks
text: more roadworks start in telford today .
this time the work is scheduled for holyhead road between its junctions with roman road and haygate road .
there 'll be a five-mile diversion in place for traffic trying to get to and from wellington using junction seven of the m54/a5 .
telford and wrekin council says the works , which are part of a resurfacing programme , will be completed by 6 september .

documents.title: party for war hero bill bray
text: a war hero from shropshire , who helped destroy seven enemy tanks on d-day , has been honoured by his village .
bill bray , 97 and from albrighton , recently received france 's highest military accolade , the legion d'honneur .
over the weekend the whole village got together to celebrate .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : all the goals from telford 's win at leamington
text: afc telford united came away from leamington with a convinving 3-0 victory .
anthony dwyer scored two goals in quick succession before jordan lussey gave telford their third on 73 minutes .
the win gives the bucks their third win out of four away games .
goalcam : 3 goals , 3 points & 3 wins of the season at @ twitterid
@ twitterid
not sure this bloke has ever played in goal in his life before .
nice win though
oh look another time he played in goal
i stand corrected
@ twitterid @ twitterid great memories
quality keeping
was that an outfield player in goal tim ?
no .
tony breeden .
a real keeper .
do we now in which sport ?
goalkeeper looked like he had an angry wasp chasing him round all afternoon .

documents.title: your rain over shropshire after a glorious weekend
text: the bank holiday sunshine has gone and the drizzle has set in .
there are grey skies over longnor this morning .
thanks for these snaps to our weather watcher peter steggles .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: world championships start for shropshire judo star
text: telford 's kelly edwards is in action at the world judo championships this morning .
the 26-year-old , who represented great britain at the 2012 olym is in the hungarian capital budapest .
she says she 's been preparing hard for the event and hopes it 's her time to shine .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: protest planned over chicken farm plans
text: residents in tasley , near bridgnorth , are staging a protest this morning .
they 're angry about plans to build a big chicken farm near their homes at wenlock rise .
the scheme goes before shropshire council planners this afternoon and is being recommended for approval .
developers say the farm and it 's 210,000 birds wo n't impact on the environment .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : your weather forecast for the next 24 hours
text: a fairly cloudy day with some sporadic outbreaks of drizzle .
for all it will feel much cooler , with highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from bbc shropshire
text: i 'm taking a look at the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you have a story or to share , you can get in touch via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live
